Class ProcessingManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.ProcessingManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ProcessingManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Class responsible for processing and update scheduling
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kyle Cochran

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessingManager

        public ProcessingManager()
        Default constructor. Auto-sets refresh frequency to 1 per second.

      • ProcessingManager

        public ProcessingManager(double rf,
                         boolean standalone)
        Constructs with a custom refresh frequency.
        Parameters:
        rf - an integer. (refreshes per second)

    • Method Detail

      • beginProcThread

        public void beginProcThread()
        Method used to begin thread. Checks for pre-existing threads, then initializes and begins.

      • endProcThread

        public void endProcThread()
        Method to terminate thread. Changes boolean to end processing loop, waits to let the thread finish current loop, then attempts to erase the thread from memory.

      • run

        public void run()
        The entry point for the thread. Must be implemented when class implements "Runnable". Updates "currentSpots" in a timed loop.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • updateSpots

        public void updateSpots()
        Wrapper method to update currentSpots variable.

      • getCurrentSpots

        public int[] getCurrentSpots()
        Wrapper method to return currentSpots variable.
        Returns:
        currentSpots an array of integers that represents the current state of the lot.

      • getCurrentPercent

        public int getCurrentPercent()
        Calculates the current percent full of the lot
        Returns:
        an int that represents the current percent full of the lot

      • setUIRef

        public void setUIRef(DisplayUI ui)
        An access method that allows a UI reference to be set. This gives the ProcessingManager accesss to UI elements.
        Parameters:
        ui - a DisplayUI object that runs in tandem with the processing loop

      • returnImProcRef

        public ImageProcessor returnImProcRef()
        Returns a reference to the ImageProcessor object. This allows methods inside the UI to access image processing functionality.
        Returns:

      • updateUIBkg

        public void updateUIBkg()
        An error catching wrapper method that updates the lot background image
